channel.title: Refresher

item.title: Refresher
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Select the browser and play.

Const LoadingTime = 5000; //Time it takes for the page to load.
Const MaxTimes = 5;

var i: Integer;
begin
  ActivateClient;
  repeat
    SendKeysVB('{F5}', true);
    Wait(LoadingTime + (LoadingTime/4));
    i:= i + 1;
    Status('Refreshed ' + inttostr(i) + ' Times.');
  until(isfunctionkeydown(1)) or (i >= MaxTimes);
end.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Hellfish Hellfish
item.description:
@Hellfish wrote:

Why not do:
[scar] ////////////////////////////////////
// BitFresh By Hellfish //
////////////////////////////////////
program refresher;
Var
refreshed, x, y, refresh: Integer;

procedure bitfresh;
begin
refresh := BitmapFromString(29, 30, ‘z78DAED97DD92E3280C855’ +
‘F09CC8FA44B24C1FB3FD21E6C32E3DE74A66796ECD65E34549D72’ +
‘12DBF92CA4231CC2F7F81E5F0F09CABD3135717B9752E6A0C7BF4’ +

‘E1A871B6890F557F8C30BEC88DC5D94ECE822B70ECD0AAD5A56DD’ +
‘1462986954317D2E54E61BA03B131C767CE4B1169FA9B5E843CEB’ +
‘0BEBF293F3809BE37B8756A9F0864DDAB9D2D41964CF2EFACF684’ +

‘D60B7DC192E1D60536C1B6491B70C7ECC8BBC55927A7A7D98F561’ +

‘733FFFDFE83EEDF7F81EFFCFF11798DD5B4C’);
If(Findbitmap(refresh, x, y))Then
Begin
Movemouse(x, y)
wait(1)
Clickmouse(x, y, true)
refreshed:=refreshed+1;
End;
End;

begin
repeat
bitfresh;
writeln('refreshed ‘+inttostr(refreshed)+ ’ times so far’);
until(false)
end.[/scar]

Progress report is buggy. Made myself

item.title: Refresher
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Updated.

Here is the Refresher. It refreshes… lol. Find where your refresh button is, get the x and y coordinates, and put those numbers on line 25. Then keep it refreshing. This is a good way to…

  • Piss off a webmaster by using their bandwith
  • Play that mouse click game, I forgot the URL
  • Bump up your page views for your site
{Script Info:
# ScriptName  = Refresher
# Author      = Ron
# Description = Refreshes lol
# Version     = 1.1
# Date        = May 6, 2006
# Comments    = I had this on Kaitnieks.com
# How To      = Edit line 34 and match the coordinates to where your refresh button is.
# Notes       = Press F10 to stop!
/Script Info}

Program Refresher;

Const
     WaitT = 1000; // How long do you want to wait inbetween each click?

Var
   Refresh : Integer;

Procedure ProgressReport;
Begin
     ClearDebug;
     WriteLn('/===== AutoRefresher by Ron =====\');
     WriteLn('');
     WriteLn('  Refreshed the page '+IntToStr(Refresh)+' time(s).');
     WriteLn('');
     WriteLn('\================================/');
End;

begin
     ActivateClient;
     
     // Clicks
     ClickMouse(234, 123, true);
     
     // Repeats this section...
     Repeat
           // Presses F6
           KeyDown(117);
           
           // Releases F6
           KeyUp(117);

           // Adds one to the variable Click
           Refresh := Refresh + 1;
           
           // Waits a little randomly incase the website can tell if you're
           // using a macro.
           Wait(WaitT+Random(500));
           
           // Prints progress report.
           ProgressReport;
           
     // Until F10 is pressed.
     Until(IsFKeyDown(10));
End.

Just a very simple script.

~Ron :rolleyes:

Read full topic
